TEXT.English: Bitis is a genus of venomous vipers found in Africa and the southern Arabian Peninsula. It includes the largest and the smallest vipers in the world. Members are known for their characteristic threat displays that involve inflating and deflating their bodies while hissing and puffing loudly. The type species for this genus is B. arietans, which is also the most widely distributed viper in Africa. Currently, 14 species are recognized.[PARAGRAPH:2]Members of the genus are commonly known as African adders, African vipers, or puff adders.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
